SEARCH
Package ca.jolt.http

Enum Class HttpStatus

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<HttpStatus>
ca.jolt.http.HttpStatus
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<HttpStatus>, Constable
public enum HttpStatus extends Enum<HttpStatus>
Represents common HTTP status codes, each with a numeric code and descriptive reason phrase. Also provides methods for categorizing status codes and resolving a code to a corresponding HttpStatus enum constant.

Example usage: 


 HttpStatus status = HttpStatus.OK;
 System.out.println(status.code()); // 200
 System.out.println(status.reason()); // "OK"
 System.out.println(status.category()); // StatusCategory.SUCCESS

To convert a numeric status code to an enum constant, you can use fromCode(int): 


 HttpStatus status404 = HttpStatus.fromCode(404);
 System.out.println(status404); // "404 Not Found"
Since:
1.0
Author:
William Beaudin

  • Enum Constant Summary

    Enum Constants
    Enum Constant
    Description
    BAD_REQUEST
    400 Bad Request - The server cannot or will not process the request due to client error.
    CONFLICT
    409 Conflict - The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the resource.
    CREATED
    201 Created - The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in a new resource being created.
    FORBIDDEN
    403 Forbidden - The server understood the request, but refuses to authorize it.
    FOUND
    302 Found - The requested resource resides temporarily under a different URI.
    INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
    500 Internal Server Error - The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.
    METHOD_NOT_ALLOWED
    405 Method Not Allowed - The method specified in the request-line is not allowed for the resource.
    MOVED_PERMANENTLY
    301 Moved Permanently - The requested resource has been assigned a new permanent URI.
    NO_CONTENT
    204 No Content - The server has successfully fulfilled the request and there is no content to send in the response payload body.
    NOT_FOUND
    404 Not Found - The requested resource could not be found on this server.
    NOT_IMPLEMENTED
    501 Not Implemented - The server does not support the functionality required to fulfill the request.
    NOT_MODIFIED
    304 Not Modified - Indicates that the resource has not been modified since the version specified by the request headers.
    OK
    200 OK - The request has succeeded.
    PAYLOAD_TOO_LARGE
    413 Payload Too Large - The request entity is larger than the server is willing or able to process.
    PERMANENT_REDIRECT
    308 Permanent Redirect - The target resource has been assigned a new permanent URI.
    REQUEST_TIMEOUT
    408 Request Timeout - The server timed out waiting for the request.
    SEE_OTHER
    303 See Other - The response to the request can be found under another URI and should be retrieved using a GET method on that resource.
    SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE
    503 Service Unavailable - The server is currently unable to handle the request due to temporary overloading or maintenance.
    TEMPORARY_REDIRECT
    307 Temporary Redirect - The requested resource resides temporarily under a different URI.
    TOO_MANY_REQUESTS
    429 Too Many Requests - The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.
    UNAUTHORIZED
    401 Unauthorized - The request requires user authentication.
    UNSUPPORTED_MEDIA_TYPE
    415 Unsupported Media Type - The media format of the requested data is not supported by the server.

    • valueOf

      public static HttpStatus valueOf(String name)
      Returns the enum constant of this class with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this class. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.

      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if this enum class has no constant with the specified name
      NullPointerException - if the argument is null

    • fromCode

      public static HttpStatus fromCode(int code)
      Retrieves a HttpStatus enum constant corresponding to the provided numeric code. If no matching status is found, NOT_IMPLEMENTED is returned.
      Parameters:
      code - The numeric HTTP status code.
      Returns:
      The corresponding HttpStatus enum constant, or NOT_IMPLEMENTED if no match exists.

    • code

      public int code()
      Returns the numeric code for this status (e.g., 200, 404, 500).
      Returns:
      The integer status code.

    • reason

      public String reason()
      Returns the textual reason phrase (e.g., "OK", "Not Found").
      Returns:
      The reason phrase.

    • category

      public HttpStatus.StatusCategory category()
      Determines the general category of this HTTP status code (e.g., SUCCESS for 2xx codes, CLIENT_ERROR for 4xx codes).
      Returns:
      A HttpStatus.StatusCategory reflecting the code range.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this status, combining the code and reason phrase.

      For instance, OK returns "200 OK".

      Overrides:
      toString in class Enum<HttpStatus>
      Returns:
      A string in the format "{code} {reason}".
